problems.title: Frequency of the Most Frequent Element (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
The frequency of an element is the number of times it occurs in an array.
You are given an integer array nums and an integer k. In one operation, you can choose an index of nums and increment the element at that index by 1.
Return the maximum possible frequency of an element after performing at most k operations.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum frequency.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 5
1 2 4

Sample Output
3

Explanation: Increment 1 -> 4 (3 ops), 2 -> 4 (2 ops). Total 5 ops. Freq of 4 is 3.
hintsList: Use a sliding window. For a window ending at r, the target value is nums[r].
Check if (r - l + 1) * nums[r] - sum(window) <= k.
